meanings.definition: To inquire impertinently or unnecessarily into something
meanings.sent1: She always pries into other people's business.
meanings.sent2: He pries for information about the new project.
meanings.sent3: The curious cat pries into the mysterious box.
meanings.sent4: His questions pries open the secrets of the past.
meanings.sent5: The detective pries out the truth with skill.

meanings.definition: To force open with a lever
meanings.sent1: The burglar pries open the window to enter the house.
meanings.sent2: He pries the lid off the jar to get to the cookies.
meanings.sent3: The crowbar pries open the rusty lock easily.
meanings.sent4: The old key pries open the treasure chest of memories.
meanings.sent5: She pries the door open with determination.

meanings.definition: To extract or obtain with difficulty
meanings.sent1: She pries the truth from the reluctant witness.
meanings.sent2: He pries the information from the encrypted file.
meanings.sent3: The persistent student pries the answer from the confusing text.
meanings.sent4: The archaeologist pries the ancient artifact from the ground.
meanings.sent5: The chef pries the secret recipe from the retired cook.
